6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Turnstile
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.description: Blink-182 praised Turnstile, highlighting their energy and creativity in the punk scene.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Oliver Tree
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.description: Members of Blink-182 mentioned enjoying Oliver Tree's music and unique artistic vision.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Nothing's Left by Alkaline Trio
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.description: Mark Hoppus recommended 'Nothing's Left' by Alkaline Trio, celebrating his bandmate Matt Skiba's work.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Wet Leg
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.description: Blink-182 showed support for Wet Leg, noting their fresh approach to indie rock.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: JAWNY
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.description: The band shared their interest in JAWNY's innovative music production and catchy tunes.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: The Future Bites
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Steven Wilson's own album, emphasizing its thematic relevance and sonic innovation. He discussed its creative process and encouraged fans to listen for its commentary on modern society.
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.source: Various interviews and social media posts surrounding the album release

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: XTC
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Wilson has frequently expressed his admiration for XTC, highlighting their inventive approach to songwriting and production. He specifically recommended their album 'Skylarking' as a starting point for new listeners.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Porcupine Tree
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Though it's his own band, Wilson has recommended Porcupine Tree's music in the context of discussing the evolution of progressive rock and his musical roots.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: King Crimson
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Wilson has often cited King Crimson as a major influence, recommending their body of work for its pioneering role in progressive rock and complex musicianship.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Tangerine Dream
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: He has recommended Tangerine Dream for their innovative use of synthesizers and contributions to the development of electronic and ambient music.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: David Bowie
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Wilson has praised Bowie's artistic evolution and ability to reinvent himself, recommending his work for its influence on popular music and culture.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Radiohead
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: He has expressed admiration for Radiohead, particularly for their album 'Kid A,' praising its experimental approach and impact on modern music.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Talk Talk
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Wilson has recommended Talk Talk, especially their later albums like 'Spirit of Eden,' for their groundbreaking approach to production and song structure.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Kate Bush
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: He has lauded Kate Bush for her unique voice and innovative music, recommending her as a significant influence on his work.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Swans
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.description: Wilson has recommended Swans for their intense and immersive sonic landscapes, acknowledging their influence on his approach to music production.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Billie Eilish
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.description: Madonna praised Billie Eilish for her unique voice and meaningful lyrics, expressing admiration for her work and influence on young people.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Lil Nas X
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.description: Madonna showed support for Lil Nas X, especially after his BET Awards performance, commending his courage and artistry in pushing boundaries.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Rosalía
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.description: Expressed admiration for Rosalía's innovative approach to music and visuals, specifically highlighting her album 'Motomami' as groundbreaking.
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.source: Interview with Zane Lowe on Apple Music

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Dua Lipa - Future Nostalgia
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.description: Madonna recommended Dua Lipa's 'Future Nostalgia' album, mentioning it as a current favorite and praising its fresh take on pop music.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: The Weeknd
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.description: Showed support for The Weeknd, noting his talent and the depth of his music, during an exchange on social media.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: The Killers
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.description: Bruce Springsteen praised The Killers for their music and collaboration on the song 'Dustland'.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Leonard Cohen
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.description: Springsteen spoke highly of Leonard Cohen's songwriting skills in a recent podcast appearance.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Soulfire
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.description: He recommended Little Steven's album 'Soulfire' during a conversation about influential albums on his radio show.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Western Stars
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.description: Springsteen suggested his own album 'Western Stars' for those looking into his more recent solo work, in a magazine interview.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Patti Scialfa
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.description: Bruce recommended his wife Patti Scialfa's music, particularly praising her album '23rd Street Lullaby'.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Grant Green
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Julian Lage praised Grant Green's influence on his playing, specifically mentioning Green's unique phrasing and melodic simplicity.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Pat Metheny
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: In a discussion about guitarists who have shaped his musical journey, Lage highlighted Pat Metheny's innovative approach to the guitar.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Bill Frisell
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Lage has frequently mentioned Bill Frisell as a significant influence and recommended checking out Frisell's diverse discography for inspiration.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Squint
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Julian Lage recommended his own album, 'Squint', during an interview, discussing the creative process and collaboration involved.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Roy Buchanan
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Lage expressed admiration for Roy Buchanan's emotional depth and technical prowess on the guitar, suggesting listeners explore his catalog.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Wes Montgomery
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: During a masterclass, Lage recommended Wes Montgomery for his revolutionary approach to jazz guitar and his iconic octave technique.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Ted Greene
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Lage recommended Ted Greene's work, especially his educational materials on harmony and chord voicings, to guitar students in a webinar.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: The Beatles
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: In an interview, Lage mentioned The Beatles as a foundational influence, recommending their entire discography for its songwriting and innovation.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: John Coltrane
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Lage has often cited John Coltrane as a major influence, suggesting his album 'Giant Steps' as essential listening for improvisational technique.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Jimi Hendrix
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.description: Lage recommended Jimi Hendrix for his innovative guitar work and impact on music, describing him as a revolutionary figure in guitar history.
